Topic.Title: The Navy Seals have been outspoken in their condemnation of Obama; 2 of the 4 Americans killed Tuesday were Ex Navy Seals

Message.Msg: You're back? Are you still throwing red herring, or have you switched to gefilte fish? From this distance, it's a little hard to tell! Let's focus on your military experience so we can better understand your expertise in the areas of military strategy and foreign affairs. The tricky part of understanding your diatribe against Obama (who BTW is the President of the United States and Commander-In-Chief of its armed forces) is how Romney figures into it. As a private citizen with no official standing whatsoever, what is Romney doing meddling in affairs of state? Meeting with foreign security services and foreign leaders on foreign soil are hardly activities in which US private citizens should be engaging.....in fact, if you or I were to do so, we'd very likely be greeted upon our return to US soil by federal agents and arrest warrants. Do Mitt's magic underwear grant him special dispensation from laws that apply to regular citizens? If Mitt took an oath of office, would the undies also serve as crossed fingers? ROTFLMAO you might think you're Audy Murphy reincarnated, but you're just a Mitt groupie. The chances of you getting into his pants or him getting into the White House are pretty much the same.

Message.Title: Dreams from George Obama
Message.Msg: You would think the media would be crawling all over a rich-man-poor-man story like this. One brother is poor and lives in Africa. The other is rich and lives in America. One lives in a shanty in a slum in Nairobi on dollars a month. The other lives at the most exclusive address in the world — 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue. Sound like a fictional Hollywood screenplay, one the Left would eat up? But it gets better. It turns out that the rich American brother made his fortune writing about his own life, and about the father from Kenya he didn’t really know. The poor African brother wrote a book about his own life, too, and about his father he didn’t know. The rich brother is a man the world knows: President Barack Obama. The poor brother is a man the world doesn’t know — George Obama. To make this story even richer, it turns out that the wealthy American brother has not bothered to help his poor African brother. Not a bit. Indeed, President Obama has not even bothered to get to know, let alone help, his struggling brother George. The two met briefly when they were younger, back when Barack Obama was searching for his identity and selling what he discovered to an American publisher. At the National Prayer Breakfast this past February, President Obama gave an eloquent speech explaining why his faith informs his desire to serve the public, and why government should play a role in helping the less fortunate among us. This is what he said in front of some of the nation’s most distinguished religious leaders: “But part of that belief comes from my faith in the idea that I am my brother’s keeper and I am my sister’s keeper; that as a country, we rise and fall together.” I guess he was talking about his metaphorical brother. He certainly wasn’t talking about his real-life half brother, George. So why do we know so little about this brother and President Obama’s refusal to help him? Why hasn’t the media covered the story more fully? Can you imagine what fun they’d be having if the poor, estranged brother was Mitt Romney’s? But much more important than the media’s silence is the question why President Obama hasn’t bothered to help his brother George. Even the president’s harshest critics give him credit for being a solid family man and a great father, husband, and role model to his two beautiful daughters. Why doesn’t he want Malia and Sasha to know their uncle? There are several possible explanations. One possible motivation is sheer shame. It is certainly true that George Obama made some bad decisions in his life, decisions that led him to the life he now leads in the slums of Nairobi. He admits to grave mistakes in his youth, to trouble with gangs and alcohol, and attributes much of it to not having a strong male authority in his life. But isn’t this precisely the kind of person President Obama would want to champion, especially if he is related by blood? There may be, however, a more profound reason we don’t know George. One that has more to do with ideology than with pathology. In his book no one has read, Homeland, George Obama has the temerity to suggest that if Barack Obama had been born and raised in Kenya rather than America, the life he has lived would be much different. Being born in the greatest, richest, freest country — one where free markets prevail — has allowed Barack to exercise his talents and achieve greatness. For his new movie, 2016: Obama’s America, Dinesh D’Souza interviewed George. It was remarkable not for what George said about his brother (he had not a single bad thing to say about him) but about the anti-colonial mindset that drove his father and that animated his brother#$%$ book, Dreams from My Father.

Topic.Title: The Navy Seals have been outspoken in their condemnation of Obama; 2 of the 4 Americans killed Tuesday were Ex Navy Seals

Message.Msg: Ya, like why HE let a TERRORIST GO FREE! Judicial Watch reports that Hezbollah commander Ali Mussa Daqduq, who tortured and killed 5 U.S. soldiers in Iraq and was detained by U.S. forces in early 2007, will be freed by an Iraqi court--the inevitable, and predictable, result of an Obama administration decision to hand him over to Iraqi authorities rather than bring him to Guantanamo Bay. Judicial Watch summarizes the pathetic abdication of justice by the Obama administration: We all knew this would happen back in December when the commander-in-chief handed over the Lebanese militant, Ali Mussa Daqduq, to Iraqi officials. A mainstream newspaper presented it as a “dilemma” for the president as American troops prepared to exit Iraq. Daqduq had been in U.S. military custody in Iraq since 2007 for his involvement in a carefully orchestrated plot that killed, kidnapped and tortured American military officers. The atrocities took place in a city called Karbala, south of Baghdad in early 2007. Around a dozen terrorists dressed in U.S. military uniforms opened fire on Americans after approaching a camp in five sports utility vehicles resembling U.S. transports. One U.S. soldier died at the scene and four others were kidnapped, tortured and executed. Daqduq, a Hezbollah commander, was the mastermind. But President Obama didn’t want to remove the terrorist from Iraq without permission from the country, in order not to violate its sovereignty. He also refused to take Daqduq to the U.S. Naval base in Guantanamo Cuba, which houses other high-value terrorists, because the facility is an anathema in the Middle East and Iraqi Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki would not approve the “unacceptable” Guantanamo option. So Obama handed Daqduq over to the Iraqis even though several members of congress pointed out that it would be the same as freeing him. Apparently, Iraq pinky promised to hold him accountable for murdering our soldiers. No one, probably not even Obama, really believed that and this week a national newswire story confirmed it.

Message.Title: This week of the sixteenth
Message.Msg: This week, sept 16, 2012 This week’s In memoriam included moving coverage of the four Americans killed in Bengazi, showing coffins arriving in USA, quoting President and Secy of State. Then three in military who were killed in Afghanistan were mentioned, two from Texas, one Indiana, one 31, other two in 20s. Fewer sponsors, though news part of program did end at :55. But Xerox, Citgo, BP, with gulf mention again, the aged sponsor of reverse mortgages firm, Pacific Life, just one high cost automobile advertised…Insurance company, too, and that natural gas extraction pressure group. Also NYS casinos at racetracks, featuring dollars spent helping education…as if those dollars could not have gone elsewhere. But the USA UN ambassador commented about Libya/Egypt unrest, pointing out the host nation responsibility for security and claiming Bengazi unrest grew initially from that in Egypt, which was sparked by that “anti-Muslim” movie trailer. Past VP dgtr Liz Cheney mentioned tensions between USA and Israel re Iran; retd genl Wesley Clark claimed any “red line” re Iran USA might have depends on intelligence, which has been shown to be flawed. Miss Cheney considers Obama economic record bad; NPC’s Gwen Ifill considers the Fed’s Quantitative Easing a necessary response to economic conditions. Political sage g f Will noted GOP governors of three battleground states are pleased by their accomplishments, which does not aid Romney efforts to win those states… More witticisms from late night hosts, including faux Obama and Romney characters talking, wittingly, of course

Message.Title: This is just the beginning
Message.Msg: The main thing keeping down the financial stocks was EuroFear. EuroFear is over for the time being. Greece will be kept in the Euro. ECB will buy up bonds if need be. Germany's high court OKed European bailout fund. Every single crisis fear issue is dealt with. Uncle Ben came out with the best possible QE3 we could have imagined. Focused on mortgages and open-ended. The explicit goal is to goose home and stock prices. He thinks this will improve employment. He is probably right. It will also make BAC stockholders rich. Uncle Ben doesn't mind goosing BAC stock price. He realizes that if the banks are doing better they will lend out more money and spur economic growth. The moral hazard issue is off the table now. BAC stockholders have been punished enough, he thinks. Stock went from 50 to 5. If it goes up from here, it's OK. Stress tests are intense and BAC passes with flying colors. Soon we see dividend increase and/or share buyback. Look for $13 by the end of this year, at least. $15 by March of next year, $20 by January 2014. We will probably reach $30 by January 2015. Call me pumper call me permabull call me idiot call me emotional I don't care what you say. I have made a crapload of money so far and I am going to make so much more. Crapload.

ROTFLMAOGranted, this generation of troops sounds about as thrilled to have Obama as their CIC as Vietnam vets were to have had Nixon as ours, but even WE never got to 100% agreement on the issue. Griping and the uniform got married a long time ago, and their marriage appears to be stronger than ever thanks in large part to better, faster, and more frequent communications. At the end of the day, the order of the day remains the same: "Quitch'er bich'n soldier, and do what you're told. It's in the contract." Ask your SEAL buddies if their union won some concessions that I'm not aware of ROTFLMAO.

Message.Title: Creating Jobs: Romney VS Obama
Message.Msg: It's become very clear that Romney would like to incentivize the private sector to create jobs... and Obama want's to spur jobs via government-funded, jobs programs. Historically, the government employs more people today than at any time in history. We've also learned that massive deficits and high unemployment are part of today's economic reality. 100 years ago, when the private sector dominated hiring, our country was accumulating immense wealth and prosperity. Similarly, global economies that are government-intensive (eg: socialist economies) typically experience economic decline over time (soviet russia, cuba, europe, venezuela, etc) whereas economies that spur hiring via the private sector flourish economically (Hong Kong, Singapore, Germany, etc.) We also learned via Obama's stimulus programs that such jobs are fleeting (most hired under those programs are once again, un-employed) and simply run up the national debt as un-employment remains above 8%. The question is, will America ever re-learn that when it comes to economic prosperity, Capitalism (eg: private sector emphasis) has ALWAYS trumped socialism (eg: emphasis on the public sector). November's election is, more than any in history, about Capitalism VS Socialism. I hope that history is our guide and we do the right thing.

Topic.Title: Creating Jobs: Romney VS Obama

Message.Msg: ... in spite of Mr. Obama's hatred for the private sector and threats to raise their taxes (top 2%) or keep them high (Corporate... highest in the developed world). To understand why Obama hates the private sector, one only needs to look at the influence of his father (anti-colonialist) and stepfather Frank Davis (outspoken, card-carrying Communist). Obama's basic belief is that anyone who is incentivized by the desire for "profits" will achieve them by "exploiting" their employees... ... that's why he believes that the only jobs that respect workers are those created by the government... which is part and parcel to Socialism... his primary ideology. Listen to Michelle Obama's speech at the convention. She praised a half dozen employee occupations... teachers, social workers, firemen, etc..... but not ONE SINGLE occupation that is unique to the private sector. Obama is the first, true, socialist to run our country. The result: High un-employment, sluggish growth, and deficits that are MASSIVE in scope. 4 more years of THIS, and we're greece... ... in fact, if Obama continues these $1.2 trillion deficits for just 3 more years, our debt-to-GDP ratio will exceed that of Greece. Our grandfathers would shudder to think that we would do this to our Children... yet here we are... ruining their future in a desparate lunge for a chicken in every pot that is bankrupting our once-great country.

Message.Title: Listen to the man and vote accordingly!!!
Message.Msg: WASHINGTON – Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu made a direct appeal to American voters on Sunday to elect a president willing to draw a "red line" with Iran, comparing Tehran's nuclear program to Oklahoma City bomber Timothy McVeigh and reminding Americans of the devastating repercussions of failed intelligence. His remarks were an impassioned election-season plea from a world leader who insists he doesn't want to insert himself into U.S. politics and hasn't endorsed either candidate. But visibly frustrated by U.S. policy under President Barack Obama, the hawkish Israeli leader took advantage of the week's focus on unrest across the Muslim world and America's time-honored tradition of the Sunday television talk shows to appeal to Americans headed to the polls in less than two months.
